dbdiffchecker.sql

Class SQLDbConn

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbdiffchecker.DbConn
      • dbdiffchecker.sql.SQLDbConn
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MySQLConn, SQLiteConn

    public abstract class SQLDbConn
extends DbConn
    Establishes a connection with an SQL database and runs the necessary SQL statements to get schema information.
    Since:
    5-24-19

      • getFirstSteps

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFirstSteps()
        Returns the first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements. These SQL statements are used to drop Primary Keys and remove auto_increments on the database provided.
        Returns:
        The first steps to be taken in order to run the SQL statements.

      • getTableCreateStatement

        public abstract java.lang.String getTableCreateStatement(java.lang.String table)
                                                  throws DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException
        Gets and returns the create statement of the specified table.
        Parameters:
        table - The name of the table for which the create statement should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        Table's create statement or an empty string if an error occurred.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException - Error when getting a table's create statement.

      • getTableList

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Table> getTableList()
                                                            throws DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException
        Gets the tables, columns, and indices of the database.
        Returns:
        The list of tables in the database where the table name is the key.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException - Error when getting table data.

      • getViews

        public abstract java.util.List<View> getViews()

        Gets a list of views of that exist in the database.
        Returns:
        All of the views in the database.
        Throws:
        DatabaseDifferenceCheckerException - Error when getting view data.
